data.title: Is there something wrong with Rectangle.Offset() method ?
Issue on iOS with quick taps
Renamed default project names from GameName to Game
data.body: In XNA default project name is Game. In MonoGame its GameName. If developer creates many projects for test, he/she may not have time for proper name and GameName is ugly and not pleasant, compared to original.

data.title: Warning improvements
data.body:
With these changes we can make Android and WindowsPhone8 builds use WarningsAsErrors and they will still build! :)
I can't figure out how to make protobuild do this though, so it's not done.

Still lots of warnings in other projects, but this with WarningsAsErrors will cover quite a bit of the code base.
Refs #2433

data.title: WP8 - ReloadAsset is not async safe
data.body:
During a WP8 app resume, the assets are reloaded using ContentManager.ReloadAsset<>. The Texture2D.ReloadAsset method then calls the async API to load the asset asynchronously. Problem arises in the ContentManager.ReloadAsset because it is using the "using" pattern on the source stream. Once the async task has been allocated, the ContentManager.ReloadAsset method exits the using block and thusly disposes the source asset stream. Subsequently, the Texture2D.ReloadAsset task runs but dies because the source stream is disposed.

you can see my fix:

https://github.com/Cocos2DXNA/MonoGame/commit/c0bb11fe3a3c8d8d176dcb93047f3573d6a93613

data.title: Renamed default project names from GameName to Game
data.body: In XNA default project name is Game(1,2,3...). In MonoGame its GameName. If developer creates many projects for test, he/she may not have time for proper name and GameName is ugly and not pleasant, compared to original.

data.body: This fixes a pretty dumb bug on my part... I incorrectly placed a `PeekMessage()` which then went on to consume random WM_ events.

data.title: SpriteBatch multipass rendering
data.body: Support for multipass effects in SpriteBatch

data.title: Spritebatch does not support multipass effects
data.body: Not sure where I should have posted this, but the current Spritebatch implementation does not support multipass effects. According to [this](http://gamedev.stackexchange.com/questions/66300/is-multipass-rendering-possible-with-spritebatch) post on Stack  Exchange, it was possible in XNA. Is this something that should be implemented to keep continuity between XNA and Monogame, or is it to much of a hassle/performance hit?

data.title: Monogame on WP8 - memory leak in ContentManager when resume
data.body:
There seem to be a memory leak with Monogame 3.2 (Windows Phone 8). Very frustrating, since this crashes our game in popular lower end devices with 512MB of memory and we are planning to publish the game in few weeks :(

The problem is easy to reproduce:
1. Use content manager to load any bigger texture (e.g. 1-4 MB)
2. Use Windows button on the phone to jump back and forth the app and main screen.

Amount of leaked memory varies, but I tested with 4MB texture and it consumed device's memory about the same amount.

Here's more information and sample code that I used for testing:
http://community.monogame.net/t/sharpdx-crashing-the-app-after-having-resumed-a-few-times/813

data.title: Build Script Improvements
data.body: This does a little refactoring of the main build script to better organize the steps and see build times.

data.title: Android IsFixedTimeStep=true Locks Up On Android 2.x
data.body:
I am using game.IsFixedTimeStep = true to set a fixed frame rate for my game and have to date encountered no issues with this.

Today I tested on the GenyMotion emulator running 2.3.7 with the latest MG develop build and am getting really strange behaviour. Basically it seems if I set the frame rate to 30fps the game completely locks up, if I set the frame rate to 1000fps or 500fps it runs fine (though unplayably fast obviously).

Android 4.x is not exhibiting this behaviour, the fixed time step operates as expected.

cheers

Fixes #2817.

Fixes https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/2748.

data.title: Content Pipeline doesn't seem to work with polymorph arrays
data.body:
I created a simple custom library with the types A, B and C:

`public class A {   public string name;  }`
`public class B : A {   public int num;  }`
`public class C : A {   public string text;  }`

If I try to create an xnb with the Pipeline.exe tool from this xml, it works

```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?>
<XnaContent>
  <Asset Type="MGContentBug.B">
    <name>ClassB</name>
    <num>5</num>
  </Asset>
</XnaContent>
```

This one however throws an error:

```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?>
<XnaContent>
  <Asset Type="MGContentBug.A[]">
    <Item Type="MGContentBug.B">
      <name>ClassB</name>
      <num>5</num>
    </Item>
    <Item Type="MGContentBug.C">
      <name>ClassC</name>
      <text>Hello, Mono</text>
    </Item>
  </Asset>
</XnaContent>
```

Here is the full exception as output by Pipeline.exe

```
[...]/MyContent.xml: error: Importer 'XmlImporter' had unexpected failure!
System.ArgumentNullException: Der Wert darf nicht NULL sein.
Parametername: key
   bei System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2.FindEntry(TKey key)
   bei Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Serialization.Intermediate.IntermediateSerializer.GetTypeSerializer(Type type)
   bei Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Serialization.Intermediate.IntermediateReader.ReadObject[T](ContentSerializerAttribute format, ContentTypeSerializer typeSerializer, T existingInstance)
   bei Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Serialization.Intermediate.IntermediateReader.ReadObject[T](ContentSerializerAttribute format)
   bei Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Serialization.Intermediate.IntermediateSerializer.Deserialize[T](XmlReader input, String referenceRelocationPath)
   bei Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.XmlImporter.Import(String filename, ContentImporterContext context)
   bei Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentImporter`1.Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.IContentImporter.Import(String filename, ContentImporterContext context)
   bei MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Builder.PipelineManager.ProcessContent(PipelineBuildEvent pipelineEvent)
```

Sorry for German exception messages.

data.title: Fixed issue #2492 (Drawing shifted up and off screen in KitKat)
data.body:
This is a second attempt to fix issue #2492.
This requires having ConfigurationChanges = ConfigChanges.Orientation | ConfigChanges.ScreenSize

data.title: Fixes To MGFX Errors and Warnings
data.body:
This PR is the start of some cleanup to how MGFX compiling reports errors and warnings.  Currently normal warnings or errors look like this:

![bad](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/103522/3588676/0ce3cd64-0c46-11e4-826e-4e6f8bda4cc4.PNG)

That is a horrible mess...  it makes people give up on getting things working.  After this PR the errors and warnings are very clear and pleasing to read:

![good](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/103522/3588699/4db7ac20-0c46-11e4-8df3-de8d369319c1.PNG)

The fixes...
- We no longer show exception data for a regular shader compiling error.
- We report all warnings, even when the shader successfully compiles.
- Better formatting of `InvalidContentException`s overall.
- Some internal refactors to make the effect compiling more clear.

This work is not complete I plan on a few more things in future PRs:
- Cleanup the double slashes "\" in the file paths.
- Omit duplicate warnings when compiling multiple techniques/passes.
- Cleanup error and warning logging from technique/pass parsing.
- Track actual error and warning counts for MGCB results.

data.title: Reverted PR #2660 as it caused issue #2812
data.body:
Reverted PR https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/2660 (Fixed shifted drawing on KitKat after app resume) to fix https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/2812 (Android 4.4 KitKat Home/Back Button Black Screen).
Some other solution needs to be found to fix shifted drawing on KitKat after app resume.

data.title: Fix android game platform exit
data.body:
This reverts #2789 since it wasn't the proper fix for Android since it was moving the task to the background in all cases without letting the user code to handle its own logic for the back button.

After further investigation is seems that the only viable option (that doesn't involve new public API to handle this case) is to change the Game.Exit behavior on android to always call Activity.MoveTaskToBack() since actually exiting the app is usually frowned upon. The app code should decide what to do when Gamepad.Back is set to true (call Game.Exit or navigate the game menu stack).

For some reason AndroidGameActivity.cs below is not cleanly merged; I tried to redo this pull request a couple times with the same result; this is due to another PR that was merged after #2789. The only thing that changed in there is OnBackPressed() handler being removed.

data.title: Android 4.4 KitKat Home/Back Button Black Screen
data.body:
We have been testing the latest build of Monogame that includes the fixes from issue #2600.

Fast resume is working perfectly if you click on an in-game ad or launch a url/browser and then return back to the game.

But on a Sony Xperia Z, running Android 4.4, there are some issues with leaving the game using the home button.

Steps:
1. Start up a Monogame based project.
2. Press the software home button to get back to the phone's main screen.
3. Use the built in app switcher to start up the game again.
4. Game has a completely black screen, pauses for a second, then it closes.
5. Use the app switcher to go back to the game again, it goes through a full app reload/relaunch.
